contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Nijō'''|二丈町|Nijō-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in former [[Itoshima District, Fukuoka|Itoshima District]], [[Fukuoka Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. As of November 2009, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 13,011 and a [[population density|density]] of 227.98 persons per km². The total area is 57.07 km². A planned [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan|merger of municipalities]] was implemented on January 1, 2010; the Nijō town and the [[Maebaru, Fukuoka|City of Maebaru]] and the town of [[Shima, Fukuoka|Shima]] were merged to form new [[Itoshima, Fukuoka|City of Itoshima]]. Itoshima District ceased to exist.<ref name="Fukuokamerges">"[http://www.kokudo.or.jp/marge/fukuoka.html 都道府県別市町村変更情報：福岡]." ''kokudo.or.jp''. Retrieved on November 22, 2008.</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.city.itoshima.lg.jp/ Itoshima official website] {{ja icon}} {{coord|33|31|N|130|9|E|region:JP_type:city|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nijo, Fukuoka}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Fukuoka Prefecture]] [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2010]] {{Fukuoka-geo-stub}}
